prompt: <description>Part 1: Simple, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a simple, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane (face_1) of the coordinate system: 1. Draw line_1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.0536, 0.0]. 2. Draw line_2 from point [0.0536, 0.0] to point [0.0536, 0.0402]. 3. Draw line_3 from point [0.0536, 0.0402] to point [0.0335, 0.0402]. 4. Draw line_4 from point [0.0335, 0.0402] to point [0.0335, 0.7098]. 5. Draw line_5 from point [0.0335, 0.7098] to point [0.0536, 0.7098]. 6. Draw line_6 from point [0.0536, 0.7098] to point [0.0536, 0.75]. 7. Draw line_7 from point [0.0536, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. 8. Draw line_8 from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Create two additional loops: 1. Loop_2: Draw a circle_1 with a center at [0.0268, 0.0201] and a radius of 0.01. 2. Loop_3: Draw a circle_1 with a center at [0.0268, 0.7299] and a radius of 0.01. Close all loops and ensure there are no conflicting constraints. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.0201, and no depth in the opposite normal direction. Set the scaling factor to 0.75 with a "New Body Feature Operation" to create a new solid body. The final height, width, and length of the prism should be approximately 0.0201, 0.7499, and 0.7499, respectively.</description>
